devdoc.author: CXIP-Labs
devdoc.details: The entire logic and functionality of the smart contract is self-contained.

DOMAIN_SEPARATOR().details: Returns the domain separator used in the encoding of the signature for {permit}, as defined by {EIP712}.

constructor.details: Constructor does not accept any parameters.

nonces(address).details: Returns the current nonce for `account`. This value must be included whenever a signature is generated for {permit}. Every successful call to {permit} increases ``account``'s nonce by one. This prevents a signature from being used multiple times.

supportsInterface(bytes4).details: Although EIP-165 is not required for ERC20 contracts, we still decided to implement it. This makes it easier for external smart contracts to easily identify a valid ERC20 token contract.

_allowances.details: Mapping of all authorized operators, and capped amounts.

_balances.details: Mapping of all the addresse's balances.

_nonces.details: List of used up nonces. Used in the ERC20Permit interface functionality.

_supportedInterfaces.details: List of all supported ERC165 interfaces.

_totalSupply.details: Total number of token in circulation.

devdoc.title: Mock ERC20 Token

userdoc.notice: Used for imitating the likes of WETH and WMATIC tokens.
